task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 227°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will start by looking up to find the roof.
My heading has been reset to 0° North, so I need to turn back to face the target building which is at approximately 227° South-West.
I am facing the building again, so I will look up to see the top of the building to gauge its full height.
The heading was reset to 0° North again; I need to reorient myself towards the building at 227° and look up even higher to see the roof.
I can now see the top of the building; by counting the visible floors (approximately 8) and assuming a standard floor height of about 3.5-4 meters, I estimate the total height to be around 30 meters.
